summary: Joyce Ann Larkin was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate she was a staff member whose payroll records are documented from at least January 1977 through November 1978. Her name appears on multiple payroll certifications and certification reports, detailing her position, annual salary, and gross pay during various accounting periods. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board specifically addresses her HSCA staff payroll records, indicating that her Social Security number was postponed from release due to privacy concerns. The consistent appearance of her name across multiple payroll documents suggests a sustained period of employment with the HSCA.
significance: Joyce Ann Larkin's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the HSCA during its investigation. The ARRB's specific attention to her payroll records suggests that these records were deemed relevant to the JFK assassination investigation, even if the specific details of her work are not explicitly outlined in these documents.
